1.verse: The Importance of Proverbs - These are the ·wise words [proverbs] of Solomon son of David, king of Israel.

2.verse: They teach wisdom and ·self-control [discipline; instruction]; they will help you understand ·wise words [insightful sayings].

3.verse: They will teach you how to be ·wise [insightful] and ·self-controlled [disciplined] and will teach you to do what is ·honest [righteous] and ·fair [just] and ·right [virtuous].

4.verse: They make the ·uneducated [simpleminded; immature; naive] ·wise [prudent] and give knowledge and ·sense [discretion] to the young.

5.verse: Wise people can also listen and ·learn [add/increase teaching]; even ·they [those with understanding] can find good ·advice in these words [guidance].

6.verse: Then ·anyone [they] can understand ·wise words [proverbs] and ·stories [or difficult sayings], the words of the wise and their ·riddles [difficulties].

7.verse: Knowledge begins with ·respect [fear; awe] for the LORD, but fools ·hate [despise] wisdom and ·discipline [self-control; instruction].

8.verse: Warnings Against Evil - My ·child [son], listen to your father’s ·teaching [instruction; discipline] and do not ·forget [neglect] your mother’s ·advice [instruction].

9.verse: [For] ·Their teaching [It] will be like ·flowers in your hair [a gracious garland on your head] or ·a necklace [beads] around your neck.

10.verse: My ·child [son], if sinners try to ·lead [seduce; entice] you into sin, do not follow them.

11.verse: They will say, “Come with us. Let’s ambush and kill someone; let’s attack some innocent people just for fun.

12.verse: Let’s swallow them alive, ·as death does [like the grave/Sheol]; let’s swallow them whole, ·as the grave does [like those who go down into the pit].

13.verse: We will ·take [find] all kinds of ·valuable things [precious wealth] and fill our houses with ·stolen goods [plunder].

14.verse: ·Come join us [Throw in your lot with us], and we will share ·with you stolen goods [a single bag (of loot)].”

15.verse: My ·child [son], do not go ·along with them [on their path]; ·do not do what they do [keep your foot from their way/path].

16.verse: ·They are eager to do evil [For their feet run toward evil] and are quick to ·kill [shed blood].

17.verse: It is useless to spread out a net right where the birds can see it.

18.verse: But sinners will ·fall into their own traps [set up a deadly ambush]; they ·will only catch [lie in wait for] themselves!

19.verse: All greedy people end up this way; ·greed kills selfish people [they take their own lives].

20.verse: Wisdom Speaks - Wisdom [the personification of God’s wisdom; 8:1–36; 9:1–6] ·is like a woman shouting [shouts] in the street; she ·raises her voice [yells out] in the city squares [the hub for business, government, and social interaction].

21.verse: She cries out ·in the noisy street [at the top of the noisy throng] and shouts at the [entrances of] city gates:

22.verse: “You ·fools [simpletons; immature ones], how long will you be ·foolish [immature]? How long will you make ·fun of wisdom [mocking so dear to you] and hate knowledge?

23.verse: If only you had ·listened [responded] when I corrected you, I would have ·told you what’s in my heart [poured forth my spirit to you]; I would have ·told you what I am thinking [revealed my words to you].

24.verse: I called, but you ·refused to listen [rejected me]; I held out my hand, but you paid no attention.

25.verse: You ·did not follow [ignored] my advice and did not ·listen when I corrected [want me to correct] you.

26.verse: So I will laugh ·when you are in trouble [at your calamity]. I will ·make fun [ridicule you] when disaster strikes you,

27.verse: when ·disaster [dread] comes over you like a ·storm [tempest], when trouble strikes you like a whirlwind, when ·pain [distress] and ·trouble [oppression] overwhelm you.

28.verse: “Then you will call to me, but I will not answer. You will ·look for [seek] me, but you will not find me.

29.verse: It is because you ·rejected [hated] knowledge and did not choose to ·respect [fear; hold in awe] the LORD.

30.verse: You did not ·accept [want] my advice, and you rejected my correction.

31.verse: So you will ·get what you deserve [eat from the fruit of your path]; you will ·get what you planned for others [or be satisfied with your own counsel].

32.verse: ·Fools [The simple/immature] will die because they ·refuse to listen [turn away]; ·they [fools] will be destroyed because ·they do not care [of complacency].

33.verse: But those who ·listen to [obey] me will live in safety ·and be at peace, without fear of injury [untroubled by the dread of harm].”

1.verse: Rewards of Wisdom - My ·child [or son], ·listen to [grasp] what I say and ·remember [store up] what I command you.

2.verse: ·Listen carefully [Bend your ear] to wisdom; ·set your mind on [stretch your heart to] understanding.

3.verse: Cry out for wisdom, and ·beg [shout out loud] for understanding.

4.verse: ·Search [Seek] for it like silver, and ·hunt [search] for it like hidden treasure.

5.verse: Then you will understand ·respect [fear; awe; 1:7] for the LORD, and you will find ·that you know God [the knowledge of God].

6.verse: Only the LORD gives wisdom; ·he gives [from his mouth comes] knowledge and understanding.

7.verse: He stores up ·wisdom [resourcefulness] for those who ·are honest [have integrity]. Like a shield he protects the innocent.

8.verse: He ·makes sure that justice is done [guards the path of justice], and he protects those who are loyal to him.

9.verse: Then you will understand what is ·honest [righteous] and ·fair [just] and what is ·the good and right thing to do [virtuous, every good course/path].

10.verse: Wisdom will ·come into your mind [penetrate your heart], and knowledge will be ·pleasing [attractive] to you.

11.verse: ·Good sense [Discretion] will protect you; understanding will guard you.

12.verse: It will keep you from the ·wicked [evil path], from those whose words are ·bad [perverted; twisted],

13.verse: who ·don’t do what is right [abandoned the road of integrity] but ·what is evil [go on dark paths].

14.verse: They enjoy doing wrong and are happy ·to do what is crooked and [with their twisted] evil.

15.verse: What they do is ·wrong [confused], and ·their ways are dishonest [they go on wrong courses].

16.verse: It [Wisdom] will save you from the ·unfaithful wife [strange woman] ·who tries to lead you into adultery [from the foreign woman] with ·pleasing words [flattery; compliments].

17.verse: She leaves ·the husband she married when she was young [the intimate relationship of her youth]. She ·ignores [forgets] ·the promise she made before [her covenant with] God.

18.verse: Her house ·is on the way [sinks down] to death; ·those who took that path are now all dead [or her paths come down to her dead ancestors].

19.verse: No one who goes to her comes back or walks the path of life again.

20.verse: ·But wisdom will help you be good [or Stay on the path of good people] and ·do what is right [guard the road of the righteous].

21.verse: Those who ·are honest [have integrity/virtue] will live in the land, and those who are ·innocent [blameless] will remain in it.

22.verse: But the wicked will be ·removed [cut off] from the land, and the unfaithful will be ·thrown out of [uprooted from] it.

1.verse: Advice to Children - My ·child [son], do not forget my ·teaching [instruction; law], but ·keep my commands in mind [let your heart/mind protect my commands].

2.verse: Then ·you will live a long time, and your life will be successful [length of days and years of life and peace will be added to you].

3.verse: Don’t ·ever forget kindness and truth [let loyalty and faithfulness abandon you]. ·Wear [Bind] them ·like a necklace [on your neck]. Write them on your heart as if on a tablet.

4.verse: Then you will ·be respected [find favor] and will please both God and people.

5.verse: Trust the LORD with all your heart, and don’t ·depend [rely] on your own understanding.

6.verse: ·Remember the LORD [Know him] ·in all you do [on all your paths], and he will ·give you success [keep your roads straight].

7.verse: Don’t ·depend on your own wisdom [be wise in your own eyes]. ·Respect [Fear; Hold in awe] the LORD and ·refuse to do wrong [turn away from evil].

8.verse: Then your body will be healthy, and your bones will be ·strong [refreshed].

9.verse: Honor the LORD with your wealth and the firstfruits from all your crops.

10.verse: Then your barns will be full, and your wine barrels will ·overflow [burst] with new wine.

11.verse: My ·child [son], do not reject the LORD’s discipline, and don’t ·get angry [loathe] when he corrects you.

12.verse: The LORD corrects those he loves, just as ·parents [fathers] correct the child they delight in.

13.verse: ·Happy [Blessed] is the person who finds wisdom, the one who ·gets [gains] understanding.

14.verse: ·Wisdom [Her profit] is worth more than silver; ·it brings more profit [her yield more] than gold.

15.verse: Wisdom is more precious than ·rubies [or pearls]; nothing you could want is equal to it.

16.verse: ·With [In] her right hand ·wisdom offers you a long life [are length of days], and ·with [in] her left hand ·she gives you [are] riches and honor.

17.verse: ·Wisdom will make your life [Her paths are] pleasant and ·will bring you [her trails are] peace.

18.verse: As a tree produces fruit, wisdom gives life to those who use it, and everyone who uses it will be happy.

19.verse: The LORD ·made [laid the foundations of] the earth, ·using his wisdom [or with Wisdom; 8:22–31]. He set the ·sky [heavens] in place, using his ·understanding [competence].

20.verse: With his knowledge, ·he made springs flow into rivers [the deeps burst open] and the clouds drop ·rain on the earth [dew].

21.verse: My ·child [son], ·hold on to [protect] ·wisdom [resourcefulness] and ·good sense [discretion]. Don’t let them ·out of your sight [slip from your eyes].

22.verse: They will give you life and ·beauty like a necklace [an ornament] around your neck.

23.verse: Then you will ·go your way [walk on your path; of life] in safety, and ·you will not get hurt [your foot will not stumble].

24.verse: When you lie down, you won’t be afraid; when you lie down, you will sleep in peace.

25.verse: You won’t be afraid of sudden ·trouble [terror]; you won’t fear the ruin that comes to the wicked,

26.verse: because the LORD will ·keep you safe [be your confidence]. He will ·keep you from being trapped [guard your feet from capture].

27.verse: Whenever you are able, ·do [do not withhold] good to people who ·need help [or deserve it].

28.verse: If you have what your neighbor asks for, don’t say, “Come back later. I will give it to you tomorrow.”

29.verse: Don’t ·make plans to hurt [intend evil toward] your neighbor who lives nearby and trusts you.

30.verse: Don’t accuse a person for no good reason; don’t accuse someone who has not harmed you.

31.verse: Don’t be jealous of those who use violence, and don’t ·choose to be like them [prefer their path; of life].

32.verse: ·The LORD hates those who do wrong [The devious are an abomination to the LORD], but he is a ·friend [confidant] to those who are ·honest [virtuous].

33.verse: The LORD will curse the evil person’s house, but he will bless the home of ·those who do right [the righteous].

34.verse: The LORD ·laughs at [mocks] those who ·laugh at [mock] him, but he ·gives grace [shows favor] to ·those who are not proud [the humble].

35.verse: Wise people ·will receive honor [possess glory], but fools ·will be disgraced [give off/exude shame].

1.verse: Wisdom Is Important - My ·children [sons], listen to your father’s ·teaching [discipline; instruction]; pay attention ·so you will understand [to the knowledge of understanding].

2.verse: ·What I am telling you is good [I will give you good teaching], so do not ·forget [abandon; forsake] ·what I teach you [my instruction].

3.verse: When I was a ·young boy in my father’s house [son to my father] ·and like an only child to [tender, and the only one of] my mother,

4.verse: my father taught me and said, “Hold on to my words with all your heart. ·Keep [Guard] my commands and you will live.

5.verse: ·Get [Acquire] wisdom and ·get [acquire] understanding. Don’t forget or ·ignore [turn away from] ·my words [the speeches of my mouth].

6.verse: ·Hold on to wisdom [Don’t abandon her; Wisdom is here personified as a woman; 1:20–33; 8:1—9:6], and it [or she] will ·take care of [guard] you. Love ·it [or her], and ·it [or she] will ·keep you safe [protect you].

7.verse: ·Wisdom is the most important thing; so get wisdom [The beginning of wisdom is: Get/Acquire wisdom]. ·If it costs everything you have [Above all your acquisitions], ·get [acquire] understanding.

8.verse: ·Treasure wisdom [Highly esteem her], and ·it [or she] will ·make you great [exalt you]; ·hold on to it [or embrace her], and ·it [or she] will bring you honor.

9.verse: ·It will be like flowers in your hair [She will place on your head a graceful garland;] ·and like a beautiful crown on your head [she will bestow on you a crown of glory].”

10.verse: My ·child [son], listen and ·accept what I say [take in my speech]. Then ·you will have a long life [your years will be multiplied].

11.verse: I am ·guiding [teaching] you in the way of wisdom, and I am leading you on the ·right [or straight] path.

12.verse: ·Nothing will hold you back [When you walk, your step will not be hindered]; ·you will not be overwhelmed [when you run, you will not stumble].

13.verse: ·Always remember what you have been taught [Be determined/resolute in our instruction], and don’t ·let go of it [slack off]. ·Keep all that you have learned [Protect it]; it is ·the most important thing in [your] life.

14.verse: Don’t ·follow the ways [go in the way] of the wicked; don’t ·do what evil people do [walk straight on to the path of evil people].

15.verse: Avoid their ways, and don’t ·follow [cross over to] them. Stay away from them and keep on going,

16.verse: because they cannot sleep until they do evil. ·They cannot rest until they harm someone [They are robbed of sleep unless they cause people to stumble].

17.verse: They feast on wickedness as if they were eating bread. They drink violence as if they were drinking wine.

18.verse: The way of the ·good [righteous] person is like the ·light of dawn [shining light], growing brighter and brighter until full daylight.

19.verse: But the ·wicked walk around in the dark [path of the wicked is like deep darkness]; they ·can’t even see what makes them [don’t know where they will] stumble.

20.verse: My ·child [son], pay attention to my words; ·listen closely to what I say [bend your ear to my speech].

21.verse: Don’t ·ever forget my words [let your eyes slip]; ·keep them always in mind [guard them in your heart].

22.verse: They are ·the key to life [life] for those who find them; they bring health to the whole body.

23.verse: ·Be careful what you think [Above all that you guard, protect your heart], because ·your thoughts run your life [life flows from it].

24.verse: ·Don’t use your mouth to tell lies [Have nothing to do with a perverse mouth]; ·don’t ever say things that are not true [keep loose lips far from you].

25.verse: Keep your eyes focused on what is ·right [or straight ahead], and ·look straight ahead to what is good [your eyelids on what is in front].

26.verse: ·Be careful what you do [Watch your feet on the way], and ·always do what is right [all your paths will be secure/sure].

27.verse: Don’t turn off ·the road of goodness [to the right or to the left]; ·keep away [turn your feet] from evil paths.

1.verse: Warning About Adultery - My son, pay attention to my wisdom; ·listen [bend your ear] to my words of understanding.

2.verse: ·Be careful to use good sense [or So you might keep discrete] and ·watch what you say [your lips might protect knowledge].

3.verse: The ·words of another man’s wife [lips of an immoral/strange woman] may ·seem sweet as [drip like] honey; ·they [her tongue/palette] may be as smooth as olive oil.

4.verse: But in the end she ·will bring you sorrow [is bitter like wormwood], ·causing you pain [sharp] like a two-edged sword.

5.verse: ·She is on the way [Her feet go down] to death; her steps ·are headed straight [or grab on] to ·the grave [Sheol].

6.verse: She gives little thought to the path of life. ·She doesn’t even know that her ways are wrong [Her paths wander and she does not even realize it].

7.verse: Now, my sons, listen to me, and don’t ·ignore what I say [turn aside from the speeches of my mouth].

8.verse: ·Stay away from such a woman [Keep your path far from her]. Don’t even go near the ·door [entrance] of her house,

9.verse: or you will give your ·riches [honor; or vitality; vigor] to others, and the best years of your life will be given to someone cruel.

10.verse: Strangers will ·enjoy your wealth [or sap your strength], and what you worked so hard for will ·go to someone else [end up in the house of a foreigner].

11.verse: You will groan at the end of your life when your ·health is gone [body and flesh are exhausted].

12.verse: Then you will say, “I hated ·being told what to do [instruction; discipline]! ·I would not listen to [My heart despised] correction!

13.verse: I would not listen to my teachers or ·pay attention [extend my heart] to my instructors.

14.verse: I ·came [or am] close to being completely ruined in front of ·a whole group of people [the assembled congregation].”

15.verse: ·Be faithful to your own wife [Drink water from your own well; Song 4:10–15], ·just as you drink [gushing] water from your own ·well [cistern].

16.verse: Don’t ·pour your water in the streets [let your fountains burst forth outside]; ·don’t give your love to just any woman [streams of water in the public squares].

17.verse: These things are yours alone and shouldn’t be shared with strangers.

18.verse: ·Be happy with the wife you married when you were young [Rejoice in the wife of your youth]. ·She gives you joy, as your fountain gives you water [May your spring be blessed].

19.verse: She is a lovely deer and a graceful doe. Let her ·love [or breasts] always make you happy; let her love always ·hold you captive [intoxicate/inebriate you; Song 4:10].

20.verse: My son, ·don’t be held captive [why should you be intoxicated/inebriated…?] by a ·woman who takes part in adultery [stranger]. Don’t fondle the bosom of a ·woman who is not your wife [foreigner].

21.verse: The ·LORD sees everything you do [eyes of the LORD are on the path of every person], and he watches ·where you go [all their ways].

22.verse: An evil man will be ·caught [captured] in his wicked ways; the ropes of his sins will tie him up.

23.verse: He will die ·because he does not control himself [without discipline/instruction], and he will be ·held captive [or intoxicated; inebriated] by his ·foolishness [stupidity].

1.verse: Dangers of Being Foolish - My ·child [son], ·be careful about giving [if you make] a guarantee for ·somebody else’s loan [your neighbor/friend], ·about promising to pay what someone else owes [shaking hands with a stranger in agreement; 11:15; 17:18; 20:16; 22:26; 27:13].

2.verse: You ·might [or will] get trapped by what you say; you ·might [or will] be caught by ·your own words [or what you say].

3.verse: My ·child [son], if you have done this and are under your ·neighbor’s [or friend’s] control, here is how to ·get free [extricate yourself]. ·Don’t be proud [Humble yourself]. Go to your ·neighbor [or friend] and ·beg to be free from your promise [press/urge your neighbor/friend].

4.verse: Don’t ·go to [let your eyes] sleep or ·even rest your eyes [let your eyelids/pupils slumber],

5.verse: but ·free [extricate] yourself like a ·deer [gazelle] running from ·a hunter [his hand], like a bird flying away from a ·trapper [fowler].

6.verse: Go watch the ants, you lazy person. Watch ·what they do [its paths] and ·be [or become] wise.

7.verse: Ants have no commander, no leader or ruler,

8.verse: but they ·store up [get their] food in the summer and gather their ·supplies [provisions] at harvest.

9.verse: How long will you lie there, you lazy person? When will you get up from sleeping?

10.verse: ·You sleep a little; you take a nap [“A little sleep, a little slumber”]. ·You fold your hands and [“A little folding of the arms to…”] lie down to rest.

11.verse: So ·you will be as poor as if you had been robbed [poverty will come on you like a robber]; ·you will have as little as if you had been held up [deprivation like a shielded warrior].

12.verse: Some people are ·wicked and no good [worthless and guilty]. They go around ·telling lies [with crooked mouths],

13.verse: winking with their eyes, ·tapping with [or scraping] their feet, and ·making signs [pointing; gesturing] with their fingers [a reference to secretive plans or even magic].

14.verse: They ·make evil plans in their hearts [are perverse in their hearts and determined to do evil] and are always starting ·arguments [conflicts].

15.verse: So ·trouble [disaster] will strike them in an instant; suddenly they will be so ·hurt [broken] no one can ·help [heal] them.

16.verse: There are six things the LORD hates. There are seven things ·he cannot stand [that are an abomination to his soul]:

17.verse: ·a proud look [haughty eyes], a lying tongue, hands that ·kill [spill the blood of] innocent people,

18.verse: a ·mind [heart] that thinks up evil plans, feet that are quick to ·do [run to] evil,

19.verse: a witness who lies, and someone who starts ·arguments [conflicts; fights] among·families [brothers; Ps. 133].

20.verse: Warning About Adultery - My son, ·keep [protect] your father’s commands, and don’t ·forget [abandon; forsake] your mother’s ·teaching [instruction].

21.verse: ·Keep their words in mind [Bind them to your heart] forever ·as though you had them tied [fasten them] around your neck.

22.verse: They will ·guide [lead] you when you walk. They will ·guard [protect] you when you sleep. They will ·speak to you [or occupy your attention] when you are awake.

23.verse: These commands are like a lamp; this ·teaching [instruction] is like a light [making things clear]. And ·the correction that comes from them [disciplined correction] ·will help you have [is the path of] life.

24.verse: They will ·keep [guard] you from ·sinful women [the evil woman] and from the ·pleasing words [flattering tongue] of ·another man’s unfaithful wife [the foreign woman].

25.verse: Don’t desire her because she is beautiful. Don’t let her capture you by ·the way she looks at you [her eyelashes].

26.verse: A prostitute will ·treat you like [or cost you] a loaf of bread, ·and [or but] a ·woman who takes part in adultery [married woman] ·may cost you [hunts; stalks] your life.

27.verse: You cannot ·carry [or scoop] hot coals ·against your chest [or into your lap] without burning your clothes,

28.verse: and you cannot walk on hot coals without burning your feet.

29.verse: The same is true if you ·have sexual relations with [go to] ·another man’s wife [the wife of a neighbor/friend]. ·Anyone who does so will be punished [All who touch her will not go unpunished].

30.verse: People don’t ·hate [despise] a thief when he steals because he is hungry.

31.verse: But if he is caught, he must pay back ·seven times what he stole [sevenfold], and ·it may cost him everything he owns [he must give the riches of his house].

32.verse: A man who takes part in adultery ·has no sense [lacks heart]; he will destroy himself.

33.verse: He will ·be beaten up and disgraced [find affliction and scorn], and his ·shame [reproach] will never ·go away [be blotted out].

34.verse: Jealousy makes a husband very angry, and he will ·have no pity [not forgive] when he gets revenge.

35.verse: He will accept no payment for the wrong; he will ·take no amount of money [not take a bribe no matter how large].

1.verse: The Woman of Adultery - My son, ·remember what I say [guard my speech], and ·treasure [store/hide in you] my commands.

2.verse: ·Obey [Guard] my commands, and you will live. Guard my ·teachings [instructions] ·as you would your own [like the apple of your] eyes.

3.verse: ·Remind yourself of them [Bind them on your fingers]; write them on your heart as if on a tablet.

4.verse: ·Treat wisdom as a sister [Say to Wisdom, “You are my sister”; 1:20–33; 8:1—9:6], and ·make understanding your closest friend [call Understanding “Friend”].

5.verse: ·Wisdom and understanding [She] will ·keep you away [guard you] from ·adultery [the strange woman], away from the ·unfaithful wife [foreign woman] and her ·pleasing [flattering] words.

6.verse: Once while I was at the window of my house I looked out through the ·shutters [lattice; curtains]

7.verse: and saw some ·foolish [simpleminded; immature; naive], young men. I noticed one of them ·had no wisdom [had no sense; lacked heart].

8.verse: He was ·walking down [crossing] the street near the corner on the road leading to her house.

9.verse: It was the twilight of the evening; the darkness of the night was just beginning.

10.verse: Then the woman ·approached [or propositioned] him, dressed like a prostitute and ·planning to trick him [with a guarded heart].

11.verse: She was ·loud [boisterous; noisy] and ·stubborn [defiant] and ·never stayed at [her feet do not rest in her own] home.

12.verse: ·She was always out [A foot] in the streets ·or in [a foot in] the city squares, ·waiting around [lurking] on the corners of the streets.

13.verse: She grabbed him and kissed him. ·Without shame [Her face was brazen as] she said to him,

14.verse: “I made my fellowship offering [Lev. 3; 7:11–21; the offerer ate the meat of the offering]. Today I have ·kept [paid back] my ·special promises [vows].

15.verse: So I have come out to meet you; I have been ·looking for you [seeking your face] and have found you.

16.verse: I have ·covered [ornamented] my bed with colored sheets from Egypt.

17.verse: I have ·made my bed smell sweet [sprinkled my bed] with myrrh, aloes, and cinnamon.

18.verse: Come, let’s ·make [be intoxicated with] love until morning. Let’s ·enjoy each other’s [rejoice in] love.

19.verse: My husband is not home; he has gone on a ·long [faraway] trip.

20.verse: He took a ·lot of money with him [pouch of money in his hand] and won’t be home ·for weeks [until the new moon].”

21.verse: By her clever words she ·made him give in [seduces him]; by ·her pleasing words [the flattery of her lips] she ·led him into doing wrong [persuades/compels him].

22.verse: All at once he followed her, like an ox led to the ·butcher [slaughter], like a ·deer caught in a trap [or fool to the stocks]

23.verse: ·and shot through the liver with an arrow [until an arrow pierces his liver]. Like a bird ·caught in [hurrying to] a trap, he didn’t know ·what he did would kill him [it would cost him his life].

24.verse: Now, my sons, listen to me; pay attention to ·what I say [the speech of my mouth].

25.verse: Don’t ·let yourself be tricked by such a woman [turn your heart to her paths]; don’t ·go where she leads you [wander onto her paths].

26.verse: She has ·ruined many good men [caused many corpses to fall], and many ·have died because of her [are those she has killed].

27.verse: Her house is on the ·road [path] to ·death [Sheol; the grave or the underworld], ·the road that leads down to the grave [going down to the chambers of death].

1.verse: Listen to Wisdom - ·Wisdom calls to you like someone shouting [Does not Wisdom call out?]; ·understanding raises [Does not Understanding raise…?] her voice.

2.verse: On the ·hilltops [top of the high places] along the road and at the crossroads, she ·stands calling [takes her stand].

3.verse: Beside the city gates, at the entrances into the city, she calls out:
